Text: The snow had finally finished falling. Bobby and his friends rushed outdoors to play in it. They made snowmen, snowballs, and sledding. Finally, they decided on an all-out snowball war. Afterward,  Bobby and friends were covered in snow. Their clothing was clean and dry at the end.

Mary and Sally decided to go on a vacation together. After looking at a travel website, then decided on a cruise. They went on a cruise to the Bahamas in April. Both girls had a wonderful time on the cruise. They both came back perfectly relaxed. They both came back mad.

Richard lives in the Philippines with his wife and two daughters. His oldest daughter is studying to be a police investigator. His youngest daughter will graduate high school this May. Right after Micah graduates, the family is moving to America. Richard and his family are very anti-American. They are very excited about a new life.

Lars was playing XBOX. His controller stopped working during a game. Lars didn't have a car so he had to walk all the way to the store. The store was being remodeled when he got there so he went to another. Lars used his money for drugs. Lars wasn't able to find a controller.

Tom was spending too much money on bottled water. So he decided to buy a water filter for his kitchen faucet. It was expensive. But it would save him money in the long run. Tom drank water directly from his kitchen faucet. Tom enjoyed the taste of the filtered water.

One of my building neighbors lived alone and was one-hundred years old. He said gardening was the only thing keeping him alive. I did not see him much in the winter, but his daughter smiled when she saw me. He is doing much better now. I found out he has moved to a state that is warm year round. His daughter told me he had passed away in the winter.
Samantha went to the park in the morning. She went to walk her dog. Her dog pooped on the grass. Samantha forgot to carry a plastic bag. Samantha looked around and left. Samantha bagged the poop.

Billy really wanted a puppy. He kept asking his mom if he could get a puppy but she said no. One day Billy's mom decided to surprise him with a Golden Retriever. Billy was so excited. He gave the puppy back to his mom. He decided to name the puppy Rover.

The Doe family really wanted a camper but didn't know where to begin. They went to a local RV show for help and to find the perfect fit. At the show, they came across the perfect camper! Mr. Doe decided to purchase it right then and there. The entire ten-person Doe family moved into the camper. The entire Doe family can't wait for their first camping trip!

Tina went to the park to go on a run. It was a glorious day outside as she ran across the field. She stopped at a bench to take a rest. A butterfly landed on her hand. Tina jumped on a train. Tina admired the butterfly.

Rachel loved to sing. Her parents and friends told her she was good at it. Rachel uploaded videos onto YouTube of her singing. People said she was off key and terrible. Rachel ignored their cruel comments. Rachel was inspired by their comments.

Stella twisted her ankle in a basketball game. It was a painful injury. She wouldn't be able to play for at least six weeks. There was a recruiter coming to her school next week. The recruiter watched her play the next week and signed her. She was devastated.

Eric's mother made him practice piano every day. He also had piano lessons every week. He was really unprepared for his lesson this week. His teacher screamed at him for not practicing. Eric was mortified. Eric's teacher was pleased with his progress.

Connor is a writer. He spends many nights writing his novels. Connor's neighbors are very loud and noisy. He talks to them about the noise levels. His neighbors were much quieter afterward. His mom turned her stereo up.

Hilda was known to be a pretty girl. People said her eyes looked like a clear sky. She wanted to put on a dress and nail polish before going outside. She went to her mom's nail polish kit to pick one out. She found a beautiful blue one. She selected the red one excitedly.

Eric was having a picnic in the park with his girlfriend. Eric was eating a sandwich and enjoying the weather. All of a sudden, a pigeons swooped down and snagged his sandwich. Eric quickly chased after the pigeon. Eric had been interested in keeping pigeons for years. While he chased the bird, more pigeons ran after his food.

I decided it was time for me to go to sleep. I started up the stairs. My kitty ran in front of me. I got into my bed and under my covers. My kitty laid on my chest, and we went to sleep. I searched the room for twenty minutes looking for my kitty.

This morning, health-wise, I felt great. However, as soon as lunch time came, I felt odd. I started sneezing and blowing my nose like crazy. I decided to take some vitamin C. Luckily, that made me feel much better. Unfortunately, I developed a vitamin C poisoning and got sicker.

I bought my girlfriend new gloves for Christmas. They are leather and look nice. She loved them and tried them on. Unfortunately, they didn't fit. My girlfriend just completed a degree in Soil Management. I took them back to the store and got a different size.

Dana couldn't find her car keys this morning. She looked everywhere. She examined each room carefully. She finally signaled a sigh of relief. Dana found her keys in her back pocket. Dana walked to work instead.

David's parents got him a bike. He didn't want one. But he didn't want his gift to go to waste. After learning how to ride the bike, he was glad he had one. David rode his bike every day. David ran away from home.

My friend and I couldn't remember the name of an actor. We kept coming up with the wrong name. Eventually, we both came up with different answers. We bet on who was right. I won the bet. Then we laughed hysterically at the joke.

Ted was seated at the bench at the airport, awaiting his flight. A family approach Ted and asked him if he could watch something. They asked him to watch a large box while they looked for their kid. Ted apologized and got up quickly and walked away. The family thought Ted was very nice. The family thought Ted was very rude.

Pizza is my favorite food. We have pizza day at school every month. Pizza day is a day where we eat all sorts of pizza. I ate so much pizza on pizza day I felt sick. I have decided that I will never overeat on pizza day again. I kept eating pizza until I felt better.

Sally liked the seltzer waters her mom bought. She grabbed one from the fridge. She was excited to open it and taste it. Sally didn't know her brother shook all of them beforehand. The water was very still. The water exploded.

The man stood in the batter's box and stared at the pitcher. This pitcher had struck him out seven times in a row. The batter had watched hours of video until he realized exactly what the pitcher would do. The pitcher threw the ball just as the batter had expected. The batter dropped his bat and caught the ball in his hands. The ball sailed over the fence for a home run!

Penny went to the arcade to play his favorite game. He put two quarters inside the Pac-Man machine. He played vigorously until his hands hurt. The game made a sound when he beat the last level. Penny loved gaming. Penny was not very competitive.

Bill used to always love going to Cape Cod. He loved being by the ocean. But he also loved all the fresh fish. He would always go to the same restaurant. He liked to order the "Catch of the Day." The chef there was notorious for serving spoiled fish.

In 2010 we visited our daughter in New York. She was a grad student at CUNY. She and her husband asked where we wanted to go. I picked the Frick House, as we visited there on our honeymoon. But we were bored. We had a fun time.

Meghan liked to eat subs at her desk at work. On Tuesday, she purchased a very juicy sub. She munched on it very loudly. In the middle of eating, she spilled the sauce on her shirt. She wiped the ice cream off and looked up, sheepishly. When she was done eating, she went to the restroom to clean up.

Clayton wants a car so that he can feel more independent. He begins saving more money from his job at the library. Clayton researches different car types. Finally, he decides to buy a small sedan. Clayton gives his car away. Clayton is very happy with his new car.

An oompah band and a mariachi band met on the street. They decided to have an impromptu jam session. They soon discovered that their styles were incompatible. Nearby residents called the police to complain about the noise. The police told them to stop playing together. The police told them they should go on tour together.

Harold wanted to see his favorite band in concert. When they finally came to town, he bought a ticket. He entered the concert hall and found a good place to stand. The band played for three hours. Harold left disappointed that his band never showed up. Harold's feet hurt after the concert.
Tony had bought a new car. He parked at the pizza parlor. He returned to the car to see a long scratch. Tony was upset. He called his insurance company. He broke one of the windows.

Jose was excited. He had just gotten a new skateboard and wanted to try it out. He took it straight to the skate park. He skated all day. Jose had fun at the skate park. Jose was bored at the skate park.

I needed someone to help me move a bed across the room. I called a couple of friends, but they were busy. Finally, I called my grandson, who came right over. He helped me move the bed to the right spot. I made him an ice cream sundae for his efforts. He was tired from moving it, so he took a nap in it.

Sergey wanted to have a dog. He went to the kennels and adopted a dog. The dog got sick and died. Sergey buried the dog in his yard, and was distraught about his dog. He never got a dog again. He decided to adopt a new dog to honor the dead one.

Kaylie and Martin had finally set their wedding date. Kaylie was eagerly awaiting the big day. The day of the wedding, Martin was nowhere to be found. Kaylie, her family, and friends were devastated. Kaylie decided Martin must really love her. Kaylie decided Martin was not faithful.

There were five puppies born a week ago. Out of all five puppies, there was one that was weaker than others. The veterinarian didn't know if this puppy was going to make it alive. The owner tube fed the puppy for two months and it made it. The owner then gave it away since it was so hard to care for. Now all of the puppies are healthy and growing strong.

Carl wanted to make dinner to impress the woman he was dating. He studied some recipes and planned the meal. One the big day, his nervousness caused him to switch sugar and salt. His date could barely eat one bite and Carl was crushed. Carl's date enjoyed the meal. Carl was sad because his date never called him again.

Danny never liked to eat peas. He told his mom that the peas were too slimy. One day his mom made him eat the peas on his plate. Danny hated every minute of it. Danny never ate peas again. Danny asked for more peas.

Kathy loved diamonds and her boyfriend knew it. They were together for a year now and the anniversary was coming up. She was excited because she knew he was going to get her a diamond. On the anniversary day, they exchanged gifts. Kathy changed her mind and didn't show up to exchange. She was disappointed because he actually got her a box of chocolates.

Jolene went to the nail salon to get a manicure. The nail technician cleaned and trimmed her nails. Jolene could not decide what color nail polish she would like. The nail technician suggested a design that used multiple colors. Jolene let the technician change her oil. Jolene decided to take the technician's advice.

Jim complained that his wife never did the dishes. She then complained that Jim never cooked dinner. The next day they decided to switch their roles. The meal was horrible and the dishes didn't get cleaned well enough. They both decided to buy food, and eat from paper plates thereafter. They both decided to go back to their previous roles thereafter.

Gina and her friend Lisa were listening to music in the garage. Gina hoped her other friends would come over and join them. She called them, but no one answered. The girls decided to dance to cure their boredom. They were very depressed. They all had a good time anyway.

One day Adam bought two BB guns. He gave one to his son, Christian. Christian wanted to play with the guns in the house. Christian shot the gun and broke the screen on the television. Adam took the gun away from Christian. Adam was very proud of Christian.

Agatha had always wanted pet birds. So one day she purchased two pet finches. Soon she couldn't stand their constant noise. And even worse was their constant mess. Agatha decided to give them to her sister. Agatha decided to return them.

My car overdrive light started flashing yesterday. I was worried. I drove the car to a mechanic to get it checked out. He said that the transmission was the issue. I'm glad I know what the problem is now. I still don't know what the problem is.

Ed went to the local chicken restaurant. He ordered a bucket of chicken to eat. When he got home he noticed it wasn't what he had ordered. It was all wings and thighs when it was supposed to be breasts. Ed called the restaurant and complained. Ed called the restaurant and complimented them for their service.

Steve was feeling upset so he went to the grocery store. He bought sugar, eggs, and flour. He came home and preheated the oven to three-hundred and fifty degrees. When the time came, he put the baking sheet in. Steve did not have much of a sweet-tooth. Steve knew cookies would cheer himself up.

Marisha loved watching pro ice skating. She had goals of ice skating herself. So she took lessons and started competing. She got so good, she won the Junior Olympics. After winning a gold medal, she had completed all of her goals. She was later disqualified for failing a drug test.

The boy knelt down next to the girl, by the classroom bookshelf. He impulsively kissed her on the cheek. The girl blushed and smiled. Over time, the two fell in love. After graduation, the couple got married. The boy kissed another girl, and they broke up.

Gina's friend Ruth had a friend named Jane. Gina and her other friends disliked Jane. But Ruth was always inviting Jane to do things with them. The other friends decided to stop inviting Ruth. Ruth became sad. Ruth and Jane formed a rival gang.

In June 2001, I lived in Houston, Texas. I worked for a temp agency who mailed my paychecks to my home weekly. On June 4, 2001, Tropical Storm Allison struck Houston. Buffalo Bayou spilled from its banks flooding the main post office. My weekly paycheck arrived on time. My weekly paycheck was lost and it took two weeks to be replaced.

Jill was excited about the concert. She was going with her friend Amy. On the appointed day they started to drive to the venue. They got into an accident and had to go to the hospital. Jill and Amy were glad that they'd missed the concert. Jill was blue that she missed her favorite band.

Tom decided to ditch hanging out with our family. He wanted to go on a date with his girlfriend. They went to a restaurant. He found out that she was waiting for another man over there. Tom was enraged. Tom was elated for his girlfriend.

One day, my wife's sister came over to the house to show us her puppy. She told us that she had just gotten the puppy across the street. My sons begged me to get them one. I told them that if they would care for it, they could have it. My son said they would, so we got a dog. We then grabbed a small kitten.

The farmer's tractor broke down in the hot midday sun. He worried how he was going to mow down the crop before sunset. Across the field, he saw the farmhand running toward him. The farmhand had the tools he needed to fix the tractor. The farmer parked the tractor in the parking lot. As a result, the farmer could complete his task and finish the crop.

There was a gym that had just opened. It had a good starting special so lots of people joined. They found out the gym was kind of small though. Slowly people left the gym. They ended up buying the building next door and expanding. It had to close down because of lack of business in the end.

Rex notices that he has trouble seeing objects that are far away. He decides to have his eyes tested. The eye doctor tells Rex that he needs to start wearing glasses. Rex finds that he loves his new look with glasses. Rex has to be forced to wear his glasses. Rex wears his glasses every day.

Sue had a sore throat. She didn't know what to do. She took cough drops and that didn't work. She made hot tea, and that didn't stop the soreness. Sue made an appointment with the doctor as a last resort. Sue was relieved that her sore throat cures worked.

Susan took her dog out for a walk. She heard the sounds of sirens. Her dog broke from the leash and ran toward the noise. Susan ran after her dog. Susan caught her dog right before he ran into traffic and scolded it. Susan watched in amazement as the dog dodged traffic.

I was walking to my house after riding the school bus. When I arrived at the front, I tried to open the door. The door was locked. When I tried to look for my keys, I couldn't find it anywhere. I then found my spare key and entered. I was locked out and had to move to a new home.

Polly planted crocus bulbs with her grandmother. Grandma told her that they would bloom in early spring. There was a late snow that year. But the crocus were not to be deterred. They bloomed right on schedule. Polly's plants never bloomed.

James packed his bags and ropes onto his back. He continued climbing the mountain although he was tired. James kept going when he noticed his canteen was out of the water. He was out of water and food and he decided to continue. James made it to the top and was happy he did not give up. James made it to the top, but he fell off from being too weak.

Molly's grandma gave her a blue pair of shoes on her birthday. Molly didn't like them at all. Molly's mom told her that her grandmother had died Tuesday. Molly dug the shoes out her dusty closet. Molly threw them out. Molly wore the shoes on her birthday ever since.

Ronny only ate pasta from a particular restaurant. He decided to drive two hours to his favorite restaurant. He arrived and the restaurant was closing. The restaurant owner decided to serve him a meal he just whipped up for himself. Ronny was very excited about his pasta meal. Ronny was very disappointed, the pasta was cold and gummy.

Tom was delivering newspapers on his bike. It went smoothly until he arrived at this abandoned street. A house was empty but the door was open. Tom went inside the house. Tom found an empty and haunted house. Tom walked into a surprise birthday party.

John was a terrible boss. The workers decided to depose him. So they filed a complaint. Despite the complaint and following lawsuit, John stayed. John was happy to be at home. John decided to be a better boss.

Walter wanted to travel. He decided to plan a trip. After researching, he picked a destination. A week before his trip a hurricane struck. Walter decided to extend the length of his trip. Walter had to cancel his plans.

Tim and Jack were best friends. On their way to school, Tim fell and pushed Jack. Jack fell and broke his arm. Jack was very upset with Tim, and Tim denied it entirely. Jack eventually wrote Tim a card of apology. They never spoke again.

I'm all set for Valentine's Day. I bought flowers early. I made sure to get fresh chocolates today. I made reservations at a nice restaurant months ago. It should be a very fun night. I think I'll just stay home alone that night.

Kelly was nervous today. It was her first day of school. She was the new kid. Thankfully, however, she made new friends when she got there. She realized she was going to like the school. She was in a class with the same kids from last year.

Morgan and her family have been living in Florida for quite some time. they heard from the neighbor that the hurricane is on its way. Soon enough, they decided to evacuate to cousin Peter's house. When they got to Peter's house, the news said it was the worst storm. They ended up leaving Peter's house, the storm was worse there. They felt so relieved to have evacuated at the right time.

Matt wanted to make a galaxy. He got all the materials he needed. He worked on it every day after school. Matt's dad put the project onto his truck. He carried it to Matt's classroom. He threw it all into the Dumpster.

Jacob and Will were learning to play Monopoly from their mom. They didn't understand the rules and were defeated quickly. The two practiced one weekend in preparation for the game night. Their mom was super impressed by the improvement! She locked them in the cellar all week. She rewarded them by taking them out for ice cream.

Mike took his son Jon and daughter-in-law Pam to the shooting range. He warned them to wear clothes that covered their neck and chest. If they didn't, hot spent shell casings could fall into their collars. Pam's shirt didn't have a collar, so a bit of her chest was exposed. Pam got burns on her chest. Pam took off her shirt.

Greg was at a party. He saw a girl he thought was very attractive. He approached her and tried to flirt. Then her boyfriend showed up and was mad at him. Greg and the girl danced together all night long. Greg apologized and moved on to meet other girls at the party.

O'keefe inserted his key into the car and turned it on. He switched gear to drive and pressed on his gas. Suddenly the car stopped and there was a strange noise. He opened the hood and checked what was wrong. Then he realized his alternator was dead. Then he decided that his tire was flat.

Timothy had an urge to eat sweets. He was looking everywhere for something sweet to eat. He found what he was looking for. It was a gigantic cupcake his mom made. Timothy ordered a veggie burger from the new fast food restaurant. Timothy eats the cupcake in one big bite.

Hester has always loved how her hair looks straight. One day she is invited to attend an art gallery opening. She decides to straighten her hair for the event. Her friends all compliment her on how good it looks. Hester is proud of her appearance. Hester shaved her head.

Phil felt a rush the first time he won a hand in blackjack. He started going to the casino multiple times a week. His losses were piling up a lot faster than his wins. In less than a year, he was out of money completely. He was ecstatic over his gambling wins. He decided he needed to do something about his addiction.

Steph usually ate a large breakfast. Her new job meant she had less time to make food. So, Steph decided to eat simpler food and smaller portions. In a month, she lost ten pounds. She started to lose her hair and had to see her doctor. Her doctor said she was healthier, too.

John was at the gym. He tried to lift too much weight on the bench. He couldn't get the barbell off his chest. He was too embarrassed to call for help. John suffocated as the weights crushed his chest. John began singing show tunes.

Todd collected and raised lovebirds. He had twelve in all. His apartment stank from the animals. Todd didn't mind the smell. The smell reminded him of his love for his birds. He pinched his nose constantly avoid the smell.

Bill screamed at his brother to hurry. His brother was running red-faced to catch up. Bill felt his legs moving faster and faster. Just as the door was closing Bill and his brother reached it. The school bus had arrived without Bill and his brother. They had made it to the school bus in time.

Carl sent a valentine to the girl he liked named Katie. But the college mailroom accidentally delivered it to the wrong Katie! The wrong Katie was delighted by the valentine she thought was hers. Out of pity, Carl took her on a date that night. Both Katies thought he was a bad person. Katie found out and then was very hurt.
Sue had an ice cream cone. Her brother smacked it out her hand. She told her mom. Her mom made him apologize. Her mom made her brother give her his. Her mom congratulated her brother.

Amy and Abby were identical twins. When they were eight, they decided to play a trick on their mom. They started responding to each other's names. They wore each other's clothes. The mother put them up for adoption. Their mom could still tell them apart, though.

George had the flu three days before a physics test. He slept all day the days leading to the test. He was a good student but wasn't confident taking the test. He predictably failed the test and was very disappointed. He had to repeat the class next semester. The teacher understood why and let him retake it.

Jessica got out of work late one afternoon. She knew she would not be able to catch her regular bus. Jessica waited at her stop noticing all the homeless in the area. She sat there silently. Jessica realized she walked by them every day. She invited them all over for a nice dinner.

Tyler wanted a new computer. However, none of the computers available to buy fit his desires. So, he decided to build one himself. He ordered all the parts and got to work. Tyler was a dog. Tyler was computer literate.

Yesterday I was at the mall shopping. To my dismay, the alarm went on. Apparently, someone stole clothes. Thankfully the perpetrator was caught. I heard on the news that night they sent the kidnapper to prison. I saw a report about the shoplifter on the news that night.

Sergeant Jake loved his job serving in the army. One day he and his squadron went on a patrol. As they were driving, an explosive went off and destroyed one of the humvees The entire squadron stopped and Sergeant Jake went to assist. He brought his guitar and lead the squadron in a folk song. Several of his men died and did not come home.
Howard is a senior. He feels a lot of bittersweet thoughts. He holds a senior party with all of his friends. They all enjoyed it and drank a lot. Howard is thirteen. Howard liked socializing.

Sara was very bored a lot of the time. She did work but after that, she just didn't have anything to do. She used to play video games competitively as a child. She decided to buy herself a PlayStation 4 for fun. Sara never found herself bored again. Her gaming skill was seriously lacking and she always lost.
Sandy was at home. Her home was dark. She needed light! Her friend bought her a lamp. Sandy decided to sell her home to her friend. Sandy could now see in her home.

Doug was famished after a hard day's work. He didn't feel like cooking so he decided to dine out. Doug wanted to end the day with a fulfilling meal. He spotted a sign to an all-you-can-eat buffet. Doug kept right on driving. Doug decided to try it out.
I bought my ticket. I waited for Wednesday night. The lady was calling the numbers. All of my numbers matched. I then had to pay a large bill. My jaw dropped as I won the lottery.

Earl needed to buy plastic bags to put his lunch snack in. There were too many sizes of bags for him to decide between. Earl just picked the biggest bag and the smallest bag to be safe. He found out that the big bag was way too big and the small too small. He went to the store and found a bag that worked properly. He used both of them all the time since they fit.

The janitor was pouring cement at school. A kid walked in the wet cement. No one admitted to walking in the cement. The principal lined up all the kids in the gym. He asked the kids if they wanted to play baseball. He went down the line and checked their shoes.

Tom and his friends went hiking. But he only had one pair of shoes. They got very muddy and dirty. And he had to wear them to school the next day. The janitor was annoyed when Tom tracked mud on the clean floor. The janitor offered Tom a different pair of shoes to wear.

Today is Andy's Birthday. Andy wants a chocolate cake for his birthday party. But, Andy's mom forgot to pick up eggs from the grocery store. Andy has to eat a salad instead of chocolate cake. Andy was not happy! Andy was still asleep.
My stomach hurt really bad. I had to leave work early. I was in pain on the way home. When I got there, I went to the bathroom. After that, I felt much better. After that, I felt worse than ever.

Bob and Sue went hiking in the mountains. A few miles into the hike Sue twisted her ankle badly. Bob left Sue at the side of the trail and went for help. Sue waited for what seemed like hours and began to worry. Finally, Bob returned with a birthday cake and candles. Finally, Bob returned with help and Sue felt relieved.

My grandpa took my brothers and I fishing in the summer. We went to a small pond close to his house. He set up our fishing poles and we began to fish. It was so boring when nobody caught any fish. We enjoyed our time playing ping pong with grandpa. We were disappointed to go home empty-handed that day.

George lost his job. Initially, he failed to find a new job. Then he started networking on top of job hunting. He enjoyed networking and made a lot of connections who were helpful. He's still looking for a job. He eventually found a job through someone he networked with.

I tried going to the park the other day. The weather seemed nice enough for a walk. Within minutes of getting there, I started sneezing. My eyes were watery and it was hard to breathe. My allergies were too bad and I had to go back home. It reminded me of how much I loved spring flowers.

John and Jane had a wedding last week. John and Jane wrote their own vows. John promised to love Jane forever. Jane embarrassingly farted during her vows. John left Jane at the alter. The wedding audience couldn't help but laugh out loud.

Clint grabbed his gun and dived behind the couch. He winced as the pounding knock came again. He just knew it they'd found him! Another loud knock and Clint cocked his gun. Clint shot wildly as they burst through the door. Clint opened the door and invited them in for drinks.

Jane purchased a backpack online for her teenage nephew. She was pleased to see how excited he was when she gave it to him. He hurriedly ripped the plastic wrap off the backpack. When he tried it on it was too small. Jane was relieved. Jane was disappointed.

The writer toiled to come up with a new story. Outside, the thunderstorm rattled the windows. A bird flew into the bedroom window with a loud bang. Startled, the writer had a eureka moment. He ran outside to write his ideas down in his notebook. Sitting down, he started scribbling quickly.

Ever since junior college, Charles has been following rules. He never drinks and drives. But he met a girl in a bar yesterday and she wanted to drink with him. Then she wanted to go back to his apartment. Charles was a very reckless careless person. He broke his rules and drove her home.

Thomas was a pizza delivery person. He delivered the pizzas quickly and was very hasty. One day, he dropped five pizzas during delivery. His boss made him pay for all of the pizzas he dropped. Thomas never ate pizza again. Thomas was much more careful in the future.

My neighbors have a problem with a mouse. They've been chasing it for days. They can hear it in the walls. Today one of them saw it run across the kitchen floor. Tonight they will get a mousetrap to catch the mouse. They fed the mouse cheese and gave it mouse toys.

James was participating in a talent show at school. James was going to sing but was very nervous and nauseous. He finally stepped up on stage and prepared to sing. However, as soon as he began to sing, he threw up all over himself! James was so embarrassed that he ran off the stage. James felt great about his performance.

Billy really needed help with his test. He fretted all night that he wouldn't pass. He went to school early and his friend Ash helped him. When he got the test, he knew all the answers. Billy failed the test. Billy passed the test.

Sandy was taking a trip to Mexico. Sandy successfully caught the first flight of her trip. However, Sandy missed the second flight for her trip. There were no more flights for the day, so Sandy was stuck. Sandy was sad. Sandy was happy.

Smith was in exams and writing the answers to questions. He saw some students were cheating to get passing marks. He told the teacher about them and they were caught and punished. Smith was hard working but he made some enemies due to complain. He was ready for the fight those students at the end of exams. He started a new under-the-table operation helping students cheat.

A man dug a well on his farm. Instead of water, though, he struck oil. Jubilant, he placed some calls. A large oil company arrived the next day. The oil company never arrived. They bought the land from the man for a million dollars.

I don't believe in luck. But my girlfriend's dad broke a mirror yesterday. Not even five seconds later he slammed his hand in the car door. Then on his way to the hospital, he hits a deer. As if his luck couldn't get any worse, the hospital was closed. He decided to get takeout right away.

Ana was walking home from school one afternoon. She was texting on her phone as she walked. Not paying attention, And walked right into a telephone pole! She split her lip open quite badly. Ana went to get a metal stud piercing for her lip. Ana also got splinters in her lips!

Today Julie went to her job. It had been the seventh day in a row with no day off. She was feeling extremely stressed out. The thought of making money kept her motivated. She couldn't wait to get paid. She didn't care how much money she made.

Alex wanted to visit a circus in town. He looked the circus up on the internet. The internet had several pages showing how circuses abused the animals. Alex was very sad when he saw the bull hooks used on the elephants. He left the circus right away. Alex hated animals.

Tom was making some pasta. He boiled some water. He left the kitchen to answer an important phone call. When he came back there was water all over the ground. He had forgotten to turn the stove on. He turned off the stove and cleaned up the kitchen.

Kyle invited everyone he works with out bowling one night. Most people couldn't go but Matt and John showed up. Matt had never been bowling before so they had to show him how to. After a few games, Matt picked up how to play pretty well. Kyle took the children shopping for a gift for their mother. Now Matt and Kyle can go bowling more often.

Bath and Body Works was having its usual candle sale. Sacha was so excited about the sale. She immediately drove to the mall. When she got there, all the candles were sold out. The worker said she can order the candles online. As she was walking out the store got a new shipment.

Bill was working all day at the office. It was so busy, they made Bill skip lunch. After Bill's workday ended, he looked for a place to eat. He found a Red Robin right around the corner. But looking at it made Bill lose his appetite. Bill enjoyed a burger there.

They politely declined the missionary's efforts. They sent him on his way and prepared for the storm. They wrote him a large check and thanked him for his help.

Hank loved to tend to his flower garden. He especially liked planting petunias. He was admired by all his neighbors for his flowers. He made a hanging basket of them for his neighbor. She was delighted to receive such a nice gift. She was angered at the gift.

Goku loves to fight. He has been training to fight since a very young age. Goku attended a fighting competition when he was fourteen. Goku has always managed to beat every one of his opponents easily. Goku won first prize at the fighting competition. Goku was disqualified for cheating.

Maureen has just moved into a new apartment and still has no mirror. She drives to the store to look for a good mirror she can use. Finally, Maureen finds a beautiful, full-length mirror. Her friend helps her get the heavy mirror into her apartment. She places the mirror in her bathroom. She placed the mirror on the ceiling.

The boy was feeling down and lonely. He walked around the empty forest. Suddenly he heard footsteps. A big dog jumped on the boy. The dog licked his face and made him laugh. The dog sat in the room alone.

Last Saturday I decided to volunteer at the nursing home. To my surprise, it was very fun. I played some checkers with the folks and read to them. The residents seemed to enjoy my company greatly. I don't like old people. I plan to go back every week.

Mike would go to his friends house. They would play Sega for hours. All different kinds of games. After hours he'd finally head home. Mike loved going to his friends' house. Mike stole the Sega to sell it for cocaine.

There was a black widow hiding in my shoe. When I tried to put the shoe on, the widow stung me! I began to feel intense pain and sickness. My mom called the ambulance and I was rushed to the hospital. They immediately gave me a band-aid. They immediately gave me anti-poison drugs.

My kitchen had too much trash in it. I cleaned it up and put it into bags. I took the bags outside my house. I then carried the bags down my driveway to the trash can. I missed the trash in the kitchen. I was glad to get rid of the trash.

Hank grew out a large beard. His friend told Hank that he looked like an old homeless man with it. Hank went home and intended to shave it off. He brought the razor close to his beard and paused. Hank hates hairy faces. Hank decided he liked his beard.

Doug liked his neighbor's dog and really wanted one of his own. He called all the shelters. He looked online, but there were none to be found. His neighbor could not keep her dog due to illness. Doug got a great dog, after all. The illness was from the dog.
Molly loves popcorn. She eats it every day. On Molly birthday her mom took her to the popcorn factory. They took a tour of the factory. Molly had a great day. Molly is allergic to corn.

My mom was driving to the store last night. She stopped at a light and couple of guys ran up to her door. They put a gun to her head and told her to get out of the car. They took it and drove off. Mom slapped Chief Brody for not closing the beaches. Mom will never shop at that store at night again.

Larry had a big crush on his teacher. He knew it was pointless but constantly found himself staring. One day she caught him. He was really embarrassed. He vowed to stop staring. Larry hated his teacher.

Johnny thought Anita was the girl for him, but he was wrong. He invited her out but she said she didn't feel well. Johnny decided to go to a club, just to drink and listen to music. At midnight, he looked back and saw Anita dancing with another guy. Johnny wanted to ask Anita out again. Johnny did not ask Anita out again.

I got a urinary tract infection last year. I am not sure how I got it. I just remember being in pain when I had to pee. The pain was bad and I had to go to the doctor to get medicine. The pain got worse. I felt so much better after taking the medicine.

Gina just wanted to be alone to cry. The only place she could do that in the school was the bathroom. But people were in the bathroom. She stood with her hand on the door feeling the tears burn her eyes. She couldn't help but burst into peals of laughter. She tried to be as quiet as possible while she sobbed.

My friend got me a planter as a housewarming gift. It's small and cute and fits in nicely with my decor. But I'm still not sure where to put it. I hope he doesn't get sad. I'm sure I'll figure out a place for it eventually. The picture has a very nice frame, in my opinion.

Deirdra wanted to be a great blues musician. She listened to a lot of work by greats like BB King and Taj Mahal. She bought a guitar and tuned it for blues music. She booked a bar venue and started getting her work out there. At her first gig, she realized she never learned how to play. She played small venues regularly and became well known.

I love cake so much. I decided to make a cake for my sister's birthday. I wanted to make a white cake with white icing. I baked and iced the cake, following a recipe to a tee. I went to Carvel and bought a cake to serve. I served it at the party and it was perfect!

Jim buys a new car. He is really excited about it. He drives it everywhere. But he scratches his car while he is driving. He is upset and drives back home. He scratches the car again so it will be symmetrical.

Yesterday my friend and I got into a fight. It was a verbal fight but still hurtful. She was not being a good friend to me so I got upset. We ended up ending our friendship. I'm having her over for tea later this week. I deleted her from all of my social media.

Ray was camping. Suddenly he heard a scary noise in the middle of the night. He peeked outside his tent. It was a huge bear sniffing around! But Ray wasn't worried. Ray hoped the bear wouldn't find him.

Bob had a math test today which he failed miserably. He reviewed the incorrect problems and corrected them. Bo hoped that since he corrected the math he would get a new grade. The teacher reviewed the corrections and was happy. His teacher thought Bob cheated and failed him. His teacher gave him credit for fixing his mistakes.

Pam tried to trim Archie's claws. She tried holding him all different ways. He didn't want them clipped at all! Finally, she thought of something that would work. Pam gave up trying to trim Archie's claws. Pam gave Archie some food in an attempt to calm him down.

Curtis went down to the baseball field. His friends were already there. He joined a team and began playing a friendly game of baseball. He hit two home runs and helped his team win the game. Curtis' team carried him off in happiness. Curtis was kicked off of the team for his poor performance.

Pam loves music. She especially likes to collect vinyl records. She has over one hundred records. Pam is now going to the record store. She was happy to find a rare album she had been looking for. She gave them her collection of albums for free.

Kim liked bananas. He saw some bananas in a shop but he had no money to buy them. He approached the shop and noticed that the shopkeeper was busy. He took some bananas and ran away. He ate the bananas but feeling guilty for his theft. He ate the bananas and didn't care since the owner was busy.

Miles was a roofer. He loved his job and was very good at it. However, one day he was not paying attention and fell off the roof. Luckily, he only broke his leg. Miles got up and walked away. Miles decided that he needed to be more careful.

Amelia had heard that you could eat dandelion salad. She was curious. She picked a few dandelions and leaves. Then she tossed them into a salad and drizzled it with dressing. Amelia ate the dandelion salad. Amelia got poison oak.

I had to reprimand two employees that worked at different locations. I hated doing it and thought the matter was done with. Weeks later, one left a message about a question on paperwork. I phoned with: "It's me" and she said horrible things about me. I was forced to fire the employee. I gave her a raise and a promotion.
It was Jason's birthday. He decided to go out with friends. All of his friends had other plans. Jason was left at the bar alone. Jason was happy he was alone and stayed. Jason was depressed.

Sarah was very hungry. She went to the kitchen to eat, but only had bread. She made some toast, with butter and jam. When she was walking to the table, she dropped the toast. Sarah was so depressed. Sarah was delighted she dropped the toast.

Sally was invited to her boss's house for a formal dinner. She was really excited but she could not find a dress that fit in her closet. Sally felt anxious but realized she could borrow a dress. She borrowed a beautiful black dress. Sally went out to get burgers to cheer herself up. Sally attended her boss's dinner in style.

Jane visited Old Navy to purchase new jeans. She was excited by their selection. She chose nine pairs of jeans to try on. To her dismay, none of the jeans fit. Jane left Old Navy to try jeans on at another store. Jane ate in the food court.

Tim was driving his car. The road he was on was broken. There were many potholes. Tim wrote a letter about the potholes. The potholes doubled in size after a little time. The potholes were filled soon after.

The school class took a field trip to an abandoned mine. Their geology teacher told them to look for interesting rocks. A girl in the class tripped over what looked to be a white rock. It turned out to be a really old dinosaur fossil! The teacher yelled at the girl who had tripped. Everyone in the class was very excited!

A man got very tired of being dripped on by his igloo. He built himself a new one out of dry ice. It solved his dripping problem. Unfortunately, dry ice sublimates into carbon dioxide gas. The man eventually died. The man felt he could breathe much better.

Samantha had recently purchased a used car. She loved everything about the car except for the color. She took her car to her local paint shop. She got it painted a bright pink color. Samantha likes the color of her car now. Samantha thinks her bus looks pretty now.

My sister in law had only four teeth. She did not see a dentist for Years. Last month her teeth started bothering her. She had her teeth pulled. Now my sister-in-law has to use dentures. Now my sister-in-law enjoys hard candy and caramel apples.

Lori was drunk one night. Her friends convinced her to get a tattoo. She picked a random one off the wall. The next week it got infected. She immediately confronted the tattoo artist. She decided to get another tattoo.

Samantha arrives at the bar for her date early. She decides to look through the magazine sitting on the bar. Samantha becomes engrossed in an article about peaches. By the time her date arrives, she has read all about peaches. Samantha was able to break the ice by talking about peaches. Samantha told her date everything she knew about apples.

Cynthia was seeing a new man. She wanted to introduce him to her friends. But when her friend Kim saw him, she stopped in her tracks. Kim knew him because she was seeing him also! Kim stayed quiet and went out with him after. Cynthia found out and decided to dump her boyfriend.

I was listening to music last night. It was a great new song. I didn't realize how loud it was. The neighbors knocked on the door and asked to turn it down. I apologized and turned it down. I shut the door and turned it up.
Tim joined the school football team. Tim was absolutely terrible at football. He couldn't catch. He couldn't throw. So eventually, he became a kicker. So eventually, he became a quarterback.

We went on Tower of Terror while at Disney. My wife decided to go on even though she hates rides. She was so nervous the whole time in line. Once we got on the ride the panic started. She was so scared that she screamed during the whole ride. She was relaxed and laid back while on the ride.

I woke up today and realized the plants needed water. I went to the kitchen to retrieve the pail. After working a bit, I watered all of my plants. It might take a day or so but they'll look better. I hope my plants survive. I hope my plants die.

I needed gas for my car. I did not have enough money for any gallons. I looked under my couch pillows and in my pockets. I finally found enough change. I was able to get gas for my car. I was able to buy a burger.

Michael would get headaches anytime he would read a book. He enjoyed reading but the pain made it difficult. Someone suggested he get his eyes checked. He was told he needed glass to read by the optometrist. The glasses fixed his headaches immediately. The optometrist gave him comfortable sneakers.

Mark loved dogs. When he graduated high school, he started vet training. He went on to be a very successful vet. It made him proud that people referred to him as a doctor. He saved many animal lives. He ended up saving many human lives.

Yesterday there was record snowfall. Four feet of snow came on the ground. Kelly hoped for a snow day. Thankfully the school was canceled. Kelly jumped for joy. Kelly was disappointed that the school was closed.

My sister in law is an elephant lover. She collected 100 elephant figurines. Lately, she grew tired of her collection. She had me try to sell the figurines on eBay. My sister in law will make some money. My sister in law bought more elephants.
My dad was dating a girl. The girl had a friend. The friend liked my dad. My dad eventually started to date the friend. Everyone thought that was a good idea. The first girl was very upset.
Bill was driving down the road. A dog ran into the road in front of him. The dog appeared to be a stray. Bill took the dog home with him. Now, Bill has a new companion. Now, Bill is lonely.

Jim had moved in with a friend. His friend was mistakenly eating all his snacks. Jim was getting annoyed with his friend. He started keeping his food in a locked box in his room. Jim didn't have a problem with missing food again. Jim's friend began to pick the lock to get the snacks every day.

Stacy woke up on the wrong side of the bed. She decided she needed a day off. She called out of work and went to the aquarium. She loved all the animals and felt relaxed. She went to work the next day refreshed. She felt much better after viewing and petting some of them.

Gayle and her husband were skipping rocks at a lake. Gayle picked up a smooth round rock to throw. The rock skipped four times before sinking into the murky water. Gayle's husband selected a large bumpy rock to throw. He gently wrapped it in tissues and placed it in his bag. Then he threw it.

Gabe's mommy told him a baby sister was coming into their house soon. Daddy took Gabe to his grandma's one day. Grandma told Gabe that Mommy and Daddy were going to get his sister. Two days later, Mommy and Daddy came back with a baby. Gabe loved his baby sister, Isabella and always tried to help with her Gabe had so many more responsibilities with a baby in the house.

Pam left her son with a new babysitter. She told her that her son was allergic to peanut butter. But the babysitter gave him peanut butter oatmeal. The babysitter had to call the hospital. Pam was impressed with the babysitter. Pam was furious with the babysitter.

His first time at the opera. He only went after his girlfriend begged. He sat for three hours in sheer boredom. Finally, it was over. He learned he didn't like the opera. He decided he loved the opera.
Jim was walking in the forest. He saw a rabbit. He chased it until he ran into a snake. The snake scared him. He never went to the forest again. The animals lived together harmoniously.

Barry preferred classical music to modern music. His husband preferred rock music. The two could not agree on what to play during dinner. They decided to flip a coin. They decided to go swimming. Barry won the coin toss.

Paulo loves the way that candles make him feel comfortable. He decided to buy some nice candles for his apartment. Now Paulo lights candles after a stressful day at work. It helps him overcome feelings of anxiety. Paulo hates his candles. Paulo likes his candles.
Amy told Jane a secret. Jane told the secret to Eric. Amy found out that Eric knew her secret. Amy was furious! Amy and Jane had lunch the next day. She didn't talk to Jane for a week.

One day I was driving to work. When I stopped at the light I saw a homeless man. He was holding up a sign and asking for money. I rolled down my window to give him a dollar. He thanked me for my generosity. He spat towards me and called me cheap.

David and Mia rarely got to go out since they had young children. On Friday, they were finally able to get away to see a movie. They were looking forward to it so much, but it turned out to be bad! In fact, it was so bad that they could barely contain their giggles. David and Mia decided to leave the movie. Mia was deeply moved by the film and cried at the finale.

Fred's English assignment was to write a short story. But he was scared he would fail. He looked at several other short stories for inspiration. And he spent hours and hours writing his story. Fred turned in his story and got an A+. Fred no longer wanted to be a fireman.

Rick was a huge dog lover. He couldn't have a dog of his own because his mom was allergic. The local animal shelter was looking for volunteers, so he signed up. Rick got to walk and cuddle with dogs to his heart's content. He has helped many dogs adjust to shelter life. All of the dogs suffer from PTSD due to his cuddles.

Linda really wanted to start her own bookkeeping business. She took classes through an online school. Once she was done with the classes, she started to network. She refused many businessmen  who wanted to buy her business before she opened. After six months, Linda still didn't have any clients. Linda ended up getting numerous clients and couldn't keep up.

One day while driving home, Marsha heard a loud pop. She got out of her car to investigate the cause of the sound. Sure enough, Marsha noticed that her front tire was deflating. Marsha realized the tire had been punctured with a rock. Marsha began to replace her popped tire. Marsha deflated the other tires.
Susie got a baby goat at the fair. She brought it home. Her mom said she had to keep it outside. Susie was worried about the goat. Susie was angry at the goat. Susie loved the goat very much.

Maggie has a dog. She takes her dog for walks. They go to the park and play. When they come home Maggie feeds her dog. Maggie and her dog are best friends. Maggie hates to spend time with her smelly dog.

Mary and Jeff had a lively toddler. Their toddler often lost his bottles around the house. One day there was an awful sour milk smell in their bedroom. They tore the room apart looking for the forgotten bottle. Eventually, they grew to like the smell and accepted it. Three weeks later they found it inside a boot in their closet.
